So...nothing happens to Jeb if he "accidentally" crashes a rocket into the launchpad, but what happens to poor Kurt if he does so?

What are the punishments Kerbals can get for doing wrong?

I promote them to command Eve colonies.

That's what happens.

Not surprising, Jeb would have been taking a dip in the oceans of Eve right now, had his Eeloo lander not malfunctioned and killed home tiny he Kraken glitch and T-pose him. Bill had to bury his dead body and Bob held the funeral rites

Edited May 15, 2014 by NASAFanboy
I would give a pilot who forgot to put the landing gear up after starting his jet, 400 lashes with the Great Medwedian Knout.

but what happens to poor Kurt if he does so?

Nothing, Kurt is the one who crashed the rocket into the Mun on the menu screen. He was last seen heading west.

Nothing, Kurt is the one who crashed the rocket into the Mun on the menu screen. He was last seen heading west.

He should have made it around the Mun by now, given his pace and the 350-ish episodes that he's done.

Anyways.

I don't punish my Kerbals, because they're not making the mistakes. I don't really punish myself, either. I would say that my poor computer keyboard bears the brunt of it. "Press S. No, the other S. Other S Other S OTHER S
Punishment for abandoning a functional ship is salvage duty (which isn't as bad as you'd think. It's safe it's comfortable, but it's like finding a needle in a desert)
